content.description: Short, but fun arete climb to warm up on. Don't peel off on the first bolt and you'll be sailing to the top.
content.location: To the right of Beer and Smear and to the left of Cripple Crack.

content.description:
New direct line up to Block Dance anchors. 2 bolts mixed with gear going straight up through the roof.

David Steele's vision and hardware. A great addition to the Holdup Bluffs!

This route is located on the face just right of Cripple Crack and is frequently toproped from the same anchors. It's a fun route remaniscent of steep sequency Eldo climbs, and has a crux sidepull about two-thirds of the way up, below the roof.
content.protection: 4 Bolts and a light rack with a 3.5" piece helpful
content.location: A few feet right of Cripple Crack

content.description:
A short but fun route that can be lead on gear (sketchy) but is usually done on toprope after rapping off the nearby route Cripple Crack.

There's a discontinuous thin crack but it's mainly a face climb to a horizontal crack where you hand-traverse left, pull through a small "roof", then a few more crimpers to the 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the right-hand portion of Hold Up Bluffs North, around the corner on the small face that faces south.

content.description: classic line up the left facing hand finger crack with a block wedge at the bottom of the crack. route continues up the face past two bolts.
content.protection: Use Gear 2" for 60mm (18m) to one hanger and a chain
content.location: located just south of room with a view on the east side of the highway. all the climbs on these walls are right of the road. you cant miss them

content.description:
A classic beginners route, either on lead or toprope, and is just plain fun. Because of this it's usually crowded, but worth the wait.

Head up the crack using mostly face holds to the chain anchors.
content.location: Look for the obvious crack system just right of the short but fat right-facing dihedral (where you'll find Fear and Smear), set back from the road.

content.description: Start on the Block Dance layback crack, pull over the roof, step right across the void, go up the left-facing corner with the tiny bush to a rap ring anchor.
Begin on the Block Dance layback crack, go straight up passing two bolts to rap ring anchors.
Left facing hand and finger crack that traverses under two roofs, following to the left.
content.location: Starts behind a small bush towards the southern most edge of this wall (before it dips back into a shady treed area).  There's an obvious block that looks ready to go at any moment... it's been there for awhile though.

content.description: An easier variation of Fear and Smear, but instead of the hand traverse continue straight to the top, right of the RFD.
